title: Petrified Forest National Park: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations              Permits & Reservations       Backcountry Camping Permits Permits are required for overnight trips into the Wilderness Area. Permits are FREE and must be acquired in person at either the Painted Desert Visitor Center, Painted Desert Inn, or Rainbow Forest Museum, at least an hour before the park closes. All campers in the group must sign the agreement. You will need your license plate number.   Â    Special Use Permits Professional Photography/Filming Permits are issued for photography, filming, and associated sound recording to ensure protection of resources, to prevent significant disruption of normal visitor uses, or when they involve props, models, professional crews and casts or set dressings. Permits are required for after-hours access and to access areas normally closed to the visiting public. Other special use activities can use 10-930 form or the 10-930s form.  10-930 Standard Special Use Permit Application  10-932 Long Application for Filming   Information on Commercial Filming and Photography in Petrified Forest National Park  For more information about special use permits or other fee questions, please contact us.
